description.narrative: The War Childhood Museum was founded in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 2015 as a new approach to reconciliation through research, exhibition and education. The Swedish support aims to support the implementation of following activities: - An exhibition and online campaign on 25th anniversary of Srebrenica Genocide focusing on experiences of Children. This will be shown in Sarajevo and other cities. - Online and on-site educational workshops for Children from all over BiH to make them aware of the past history and how to build a better future for everyone. Aim: to reach and work with 1700 students, ages 9-19, coming from different parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina. - An online platform for education on human rights, democracy and peace building –lessons from Bosnia and Herzegovina. Target group: students from abroad, ages 17-25. Aim: The workshop is designed to explore new and participatory forms of remembrance through the work with a single group of students (max 15 participants) over the course of eight weeks.

The War Childhood Museum was founded in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 2015 as a new approach to reconciliation. It soon became an institution with a wide range of activities and a permanent museum in Sarajevo. Three main pillars of the WCM's activities are research, exhibition and education. There are many specific projects and initiatives within these three main groups which include: research activities (collecting and documenting the experience of people whose childhoods have been affected by war), production activities (production and editing of collected materials), exhibition activities (permanent, travelling and pop-up exhibitions, online campaigns, social media and media, etc), educational activities (group visits to permanent exhibition, workshops with school children and teachers).
War Childhood Museum is a new partner of the Embassy of Sweden in Sarajevo but the musuem and exhibition is well know and very well thought of. The Swedish support aims to support the implementation of following activities:
- Online and on-site educational workshops for Children from all over BiH to make them aware of the past history and how to build a better future for everyone. Aim is to reach around 1100 Children through this activity. - An exhibition and online campaign on 25th anniversary of Srebrenica Genocide focusing on experiences of Children. - An online platform for education on human rights, democracy and peace building – lessons from Bosnia and Herzegovina.

War Childhood Museum grundades i Bosnien och Hercegovina år 2015 som en metod för bearbetning och försoning. Det blev snart en institution med ett brett utbud av aktiviteter och ett permanent museum i Sarajevo. Tre huvudpelare i museets verksamhet är forskning, utställning och utbildning. Det finns många specifika projekt och initiativ inom dessa tre huvudgrupper vilket inkluderar: forskningsaktiviteter (insamling och dokumentation av erfarenheter från människor vars barndom har påverkats av krig), produktionsaktiviteter (produktion och redigering av insamlat material), utställningsaktiviteter (permanenta, resande och pop-up-utställningar, onlinekampanjer, sociala medier och media, etc.), utbildningsaktiviteter (gruppbesök på permanent utställning, workshops med skolbarn och lärare).
War Childhood Museum är en ny partner för Sveriges ambassad i Sarajevo men museet och dess utställning är välkänt och välrenommerat. Sveriges stöd syftar till att stödja genomförandet av följande aktiviteter:
- Utbildningsworkshops, både online och på plats, för barn från hela Bosnien och Hercegovina för att göra dem medvetna om landets nutidshistoria och hur en bättre framtid för alla kan byggas. Syftet är att nå cirka 1100 barn genom denna aktivitet. - En utställning och onlinekampanj i samband med 25-års minnesdagen av folkmordet i Srebrenica med fokus på barns upplevelser. - En online-plattform för utbildning om mänskliga rättigheter, demokrati och fredsbyggande - utifrån erfarenheter från Bosnien och Hercegovina.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The exhibition was initially planned for the 7th- 11th of July (to coincide with the anniversary) but was delayed 3,5 weeks due to covid-related issues in producing the material. Due to the delays, the War Childhood Museum decided not to move the exhibition to other cities in BiH with the explanation that scares are not healed in the BiH society and therefore, to continue to talk about and to remember the Genocide outside the month of July can have negative implications. This was also justified as the online-campaign had such a broad reach. The educational workshops for children started in September and will be implemented until December. Interest in participating in the activities has been high so far. The online platform for education on human rights, democracy and peace building has yet not started why nothing can be said at the moment. A report will be submitted by the end of the project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
